overview: From 2025-10-19 to 2025-10-26, Sendo-labs/leaderboard had 8 new PRs (7 merged), 0 new issues, and 1 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat: X social scoring
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
## X/Twitter Integration

Implements basic X activity tracking for users who link their accounts.

### What's Working
- ‚úÖ OAuth linking via Cloudflare Worker
- ‚úÖ JWT-based account verification
- ‚úÖ Activity ingestion pipeline (mentions, posts, retweets, replies)
- ‚úÖ Database schema (socialAccounts, xActivities)
- ‚úÖ Social score calculation and aggregation
- ‚úÖ UI display (ùïè icon on leaderboard, activity stats on profiles)

### Implementation
- **API**: twitterapi.io for scraping (1 req/5s rate limit)
- **Query**: `@SendoMarket OR from:SendoMarket include:nativeretweets` captures all relevant activity in 1 call
- **Strategy**: Global search + filter by linked users (scales efficiently)
- **Storage**: Idempotent upserts, engagement metrics updated on each run

### What's Missing for the moment
- Multi-platform architecture (LK, TG and others)
- Detailed activity lists and charts
- Advanced UI components (tabs, graphs, filters)

### Testing
Pipeline successfully runs daily, captures activities from linked accounts.

topPRs.title: feat: add json endpoints
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
# Add JSON Leaderboard API Endpoints

## Summary

This PR adds static JSON API endpoints for leaderboard data, enabling external applications, mobile apps, and third-party integrations to consume leaderboard information programmatically.

## Features

- **Three time periods**: Monthly, weekly, and lifetime leaderboards
- **Comprehensive scoring**: Includes total score plus breakdown by contribution type (PR, issue, review, comment)
- **Wallet addresses**: Includes Solana and Ethereum wallet addresses from GitHub profiles
- **Calendar-based periods**: 
  - Weekly: Sunday to today
  - Monthly: 1st of month to today
  - Lifetime: Project start date to today
- **CLI command**: `bun run pipeline export-leaderboard`
- **CI/CD integration**: Automatically generates fresh leaderboard data on every deployment
- **Full test coverage**: 9 comprehensive tests covering all scenarios

## API Endpoints

The following static JSON files will be available via GitHub Pages:

- `/data/api/leaderboard-monthly.json`
- `/data/api/leaderboard-weekly.json`
- `/data/api/leaderboard-lifetime.json`

## Response Format

```json
{
  "period": "monthly",
  "startDate": "2025-10-01",
  "endDate": "2025-10-23",
  "generatedAt": "2025-10-23T11:12:25.933Z",
  "totalUsers": 150,
  "leaderboard": [
    {
      "rank": 1,
      "username": "contributor1",
      "avatarUrl": "https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/...",
      "score": 1234.5,
      "prScore": 800.0,
      "issueScore": 200.0,
      "reviewScore": 150.5,
      "commentScore": 84.0,
      "wallets": {
        "solana": "9xQeWvG816bUx9EPjHmaT23yvVM2ZWbrrpZb9PusVFin",
        "ethereum": "0x742d35Cc6634C0532925a3b844Bc9e7595f0bEb"
      }
    }
  ]
}
```

## Use Cases
- Mobile apps: Display leaderboard data in native applications
- Discord bots: Show contributor rankings and stats
- Analytics dashboards: Track contributor engagement over time
- Reward systems: Automate token distributions based on rankings
- Third-party integrations: Enable community-built tools and services

## Testing
All tests pass successfully:
- bun test src/lib/pipelines/export/exportLeaderboardAPI.test.ts

topContributors.summary: standujar: Made a foundational contribution by delivering the initial implementation of the Sendo Worker in `Sendo-labs/plugin-sendo-worker#1`, a significant effort involving over 13,000 lines of code. They also enhanced the `Sendo-labs/leaderboard` repository by adding new projects and JSON endpoints via PRs #3 and #4. Their activity shows a primary focus on feature work, bug fixes, and establishing test infrastructure.

Neysixx: Focused on significant refactoring and feature development in the Sendo-labs/frontend repository, landing several impactful changes. They executed a large-scale improvement to the page structure (Sendo-labs/frontend#3), refactored the worker-plugin (Sendo-labs/frontend#6), and resolved a critical build issue by adding missing dependencies (Sendo-labs/frontend#5). This work demonstrates a primary focus on refactoring, which accounted for the majority of their code changes.

xdrkush: This week, xdrkush focused on resolving an issue within the `sendo-api` repository, merging PR #3 to address a bug in the buy/sell account functionality. This was a notable contribution with over 700 lines of changes across 17 files. Their work was evenly split between bug fixes and feature development, including updates to both application code and tests.

MonteCrypto999: Focused on a significant feature addition for the Jupiter plugin, opening a pull request to add referral fee support (Sendo-labs/plugin-jupiter#1). This large-scale effort introduced over 5,900 lines of code across 31 files. The work primarily involved feature implementation, configuration changes, and the addition of new tests.

M4XGO: Focused on improving project infrastructure by establishing automated release management and NPM publishing workflows in the Sendo-labs/plugin-cryptoscore repository (PR #2). This work consisted entirely of modifications to configuration files, indicating a primary focus on tooling and deployment processes.

tionebDotsamapha: This week's focus was on improving project documentation, merging a pull request in Sendo-labs/sendo-api (#2) to update the README file. Their contributions were entirely focused on documentation.
